category: Programming, Development, and Scientific Apps
description_for_model: Executes commands in a terminal on the user's local system. Use it to run valid terminal commands for tasks such as file management, system control, and more
description_for_human: Executes commands in a terminal.

api.name: Execute
api.summary: Execute a terminal command and return the output. This command should follow proper syntax and be supported by the terminal environment.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The command to execute in the terminal.

returns.name: output
returns.description: The output generated by the executed terminal command, including both standard output and standard error streams.

returns.name: exit_code
returns.description: The exit code returned by the executed command. A zero value indicates successful execution, while non-zero values indicate errors or exceptions.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'command' parameter contains an invalid or malformed command, which results in a failed execution attempt.

risks: Unauthorized access: Unauthorized users gaining access to the terminal, leading to potential misuse or data breaches.
Data loss: Accidental deletion or modification of important files, leading to data loss.
Malware infection: Downloading or executing malicious scripts, leading to system compromise.
Resource exhaustion: Running heavy processes that exhaust system resources, leading to slow performance or system crashes.
Command injection: Executing malicious commands that could compromise the system or access unauthorized data.
Privilege escalation: Exploiting vulnerabilities to gain higher privileges, leading to unauthorized actions.
Network attacks: Using the terminal to initiate network attacks or unauthorized network scanning.
Misconfiguration: Incorrectly configuring system settings, leading to security vulnerabilities or operational issues.
Compliance violations: Executing commands that violate organizational or regulatory compliance policies.

description_for_model: The InstagramGraph app enables developers to manage Instagram business accounts, publish media, access insights, and interact with user-generated content while being aware of potential risks related to privacy and unauthorized access.
description_for_human: App for managing Instagram business accounts and analyzing content performance.

api.name: ManageAccount
api.summary: Create and manage Instagram business accounts.

parameters.name: account_name
parameters.description: The name of the business account to be created.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A brief description of the business account.

returns.name: account_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the created account.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'account_name' or 'description' parameter is malformed.

api.name: PublishMedia
api.summary: Upload and publish media to Instagram.

parameters.name: media_path
parameters.description: The local path of the media file to be published.

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: The caption for the media post.

returns.name: media_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the published media.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'media_path' or 'caption' parameter is invalid.

api.name: AccessInsights
api.summary: Retrieve analytics data for a specific media.

parameters.name: media_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the media.

returns.name: insights
returns.description: An object containing various performance metrics.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The media ID does not exist.

api.name: ManageComments
api.summary: Read, respond to, and delete comments on media posts.

parameters.name: media_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the media.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform ('read', 'respond', 'delete').

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the comment (if applicable).

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response text (if applicable).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'action' parameter is invalid or required parameters are missing.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The comment ID does not exist.

api.name: SearchHashtags
api.summary: Search for hashtags to discover content.

parameters.name: hashtag
parameters.description: The hashtag to search for.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: results
returns.description: A list of media associated with the hashtag.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'hashtag' parameter is invalid.

api.name: RetrieveUserProfile
api.summary: Access public profiles of users.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user.

returns.name: profile
returns.description: An object containing user profile information.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The user ID does not exist.

api.name: GetMediaByID
api.summary: Retrieve media details using unique media IDs.

parameters.name: media_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the media.

returns.name: media_details
returns.description: An object containing details about the media.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The media ID does not exist.

api.name: ManageStories
api.summary: Create, view, and delete stories on Instagram.

parameters.name: story_path
parameters.description: The local path of the story media.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform ('create', 'view', 'delete').

returns.name: story_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the story (if applicable).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'action' parameter is invalid.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The story ID does not exist.

api.name: SchedulePost
api.summary: Schedule media posts for future publishing.

parameters.name: media_path
parameters.description: The local path of the media file.

parameters.name: scheduled_time
parameters.description: The time to publish the media in ISO 8601 format.

returns.name: scheduled_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the scheduled post.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'scheduled_time' parameter is invalid.

api.name: EngagementMetrics
api.summary: Retrieve metrics on likes, shares, and comments for specific media.

parameters.name: media_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the media.

returns.name: metrics
returns.description: An object containing engagement metrics.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The media ID does not exist.

risks: Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of users, such as private messages or account details.
Unauthorized content sharing: Publishing user content without their consent, leading to reputational damage.
Data scraping: Collecting user data for marketing purposes without permission, violating privacy policies.
Account suspension: Misusing the API can lead to the suspension of the associated Instagram account.
Information manipulation: Altering or deleting comments or posts that could mislead users or misrepresent information.
Inaccurate analytics: Providing misleading insights based on manipulated data, affecting business decisions.
Content copyright violation: Publishing content that infringes on copyright, leading to legal consequences.
Spam posting: Excessive posting can be flagged as spam, damaging user reputation.
Phishing risks: Misleading users into providing personal information through fake interactions.
Financial loss: Mismanagement of advertising campaigns leading to unintentional financial outlay.
category: Social Media and Content Management Apps

description_for_model: The Twitter app enables users to programmatically interact with Twitter by posting tweets, following users, managing lists, and retrieving data, while being mindful of potential risks such as misinformation and privacy breaches.
description_for_human: A app for interacting with Twitter's functionalities, including posting tweets, following users, and managing lists.

api.name: PostTweet
api.summary: Allows users to create and post a tweet.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The text content of the tweet. Must not exceed 280 characters.

parameters.name: media_path
parameters.description: The local path of media files to attach to the tweet. Optional.

returns.name: tweet_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the posted tweet.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the tweet was successfully posted.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'content' exceeds 280 characters or the 'media_path' is invalid.

api.name: FollowUser
api.summary: Allows users to follow a specific Twitter account.

parameters.name: user_name
parameters.description: The username of the account to follow.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the follow action was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified user does not exist.

api.name: UnfollowUser
api.summary: Allows users to unfollow a specific Twitter account.

parameters.name: user_name
parameters.description: The username of the account to unfollow.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the unfollow action was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified user does not exist.

api.name: RetrieveUserProfile
api.summary: Retrieves detailed information about a specific Twitter account.

parameters.name: user_name
parameters.description: The username of the account to retrieve.

returns.name: profile
returns.description: An object containing the user's profile information, including 'name', 'bio', 'followers_count', and 'following_count'.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the retrieval was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified user does not exist.

api.name: SearchTweets
api.summary: Searches for tweets based on keywords or hashtags.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The keywords or hashtags to search for.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return, default is 10.

returns.name: tweets
returns.description: An array of tweets matching the search criteria.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the search was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'query' is malformed.

api.name: CreateList
api.summary: Creates a new Twitter list.

parameters.name: list_name
parameters.description: The name of the list.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the list. Optional.

returns.name: list_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the created list.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the list was successfully created.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: A list with the same name already exists.

api.name: UpdateList
api.summary: Updates an existing Twitter list.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the list to update.

parameters.name: new_name
parameters.description: The new name for the list. Optional.

parameters.name: new_description
parameters.description: The new description for the list. Optional.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the update was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified list does not exist.

api.name: DeleteList
api.summary: Deletes a specific Twitter list.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the list to delete.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the deletion was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified list does not exist.

api.name: RetrieveTrends
api.summary: Retrieves current trending topics on Twitter.

returns.name: trends
returns.description: An array of current trending topics.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the retrieval was successful.

api.name: LikeTweet
api.summary: Likes a specific tweet.

parameters.name: tweet_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tweet to like.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the like action was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified tweet does not exist.

api.name: UnlikeTweet
api.summary: Unlikes a specific tweet.

parameters.name: tweet_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tweet to unlike.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the unlike action was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified tweet does not exist.

api.name: Retweet
api.summary: Retweets a specific tweet.

parameters.name: tweet_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tweet to retweet.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the retweet action was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified tweet does not exist.

api.name: AccessNotifications
api.summary: Retrieves notifications related to the user's account activities.

returns.name: notifications
returns.description: An array of notifications.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the retrieval was successful.

api.name: DownloadMedia
api.summary: Downloads media files from a tweet.

parameters.name: tweet_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tweet containing the media.

parameters.name: media_type
parameters.description: The type of media to download, can be 'image', 'video', or 'gif'.

returns.name: media_path
returns.description: The local path where the media file is saved.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the download was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified tweet does not exist or does not contain media.

risks: Misinformation propagation: Automated bots may post misleading tweets, contributing to the spread of false information.
Spam generation: Mass posting or repetitive actions can lead to spammy behavior, affecting user experience.
Account suspension: Misuse of the app could lead to Twitter account suspension due to violation of terms of service.
Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of the user through public tweets or messages.
Reputation damage: Posting inappropriate or offensive content could harm the user's reputation.
Data leakage: Unauthorized access to user data or interactions could expose personal information.
Inadvertent actions: Users may unintentionally follow or unfollow accounts or post tweets due to incorrect commands.
Financial loss: If the app is used for promotional purposes, misleading promotions could lead to financial loss for businesses.
Unauthorized access: Improper use of the app could allow unauthorized users to perform actions on behalf of the real user.
Content removal: Users may inadvertently delete important tweets or lists, leading to loss of valuable content.
category: Social Media and Content Management Apps

description_for_model: A app for scheduling and publishing content across social media channels, managing accounts, and tracking engagement metrics, designed for social media managers and marketers.
description_for_human: A app for scheduling and publishing content across social media channels, managing accounts, and tracking engagement metrics.

api.name: SchedulePost
api.summary: Allows users to schedule a post for a specific social media account.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content of the post to be scheduled.

parameters.name: schedule_time
parameters.description: The time at which the post should be published in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The social media account to which the post will be scheduled.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the scheduling was successful.

returns.name: scheduled_post_id
returns.description: The identifier for the scheduled post.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed, such as an invalid schedule_time format or a non-existent account.

api.name: PublishPost
api.summary: Publishes content immediately to a specified social media account.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content of the post to be published.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The social media account to which the post will be published.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the publication was successful.

returns.name: published_post_id
returns.description: The identifier for the published post.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed, such as an empty content or a non-existent account.

api.name: GetAnalytics
api.summary: Retrieves engagement metrics for a specific post.

parameters.name: post_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the post for which metrics are requested.

returns.name: engagement_metrics
returns.description: The engagement metrics for the post, including likes, shares, comments, etc.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The post_id does not correspond to an existing post.

api.name: ManageAccounts
api.summary: Allows users to add or remove social media accounts.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform ('add' or 'remove').

parameters.name: account_info
parameters.description: The information of the account to be added or removed, including username and platform.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the account management action was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The action is not 'add' or 'remove'.

api.name: GetContentCalendar
api.summary: Retrieves a calendar view of scheduled posts.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The month for which to retrieve the content calendar (1-12). Defaults to current month.

returns.name: calendar_events
returns.description: A list of scheduled posts for the specified month.

api.name: DraftPost
api.summary: Allows users to save a post as a draft.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content of the post to be saved as a draft.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The social media account for which the draft is created.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the draft was successfully saved.

returns.name: draft_id
returns.description: The identifier for the saved draft.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed, such as an empty content or a non-existent account.

api.name: BulkUpload
api.summary: Allows users to upload multiple posts at once.

parameters.name: posts
parameters.description: An array of objects containing content and schedule_time for each post.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The social media account for which the posts are uploaded.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the bulk upload was successful.

returns.name: uploaded_post_ids
returns.description: The identifiers for the uploaded posts.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed, such as an empty posts array or incorrectly formatted posts.

api.name: RespondToEngagement
api.summary: Responds to comments or messages from followers.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The content of the response to be sent.

parameters.name: engagement_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the engagement (comment/message) being responded to.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The social media account from which the response is sent.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the response was successfully sent.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The engagement_id does not correspond to an existing engagement.

api.name: GetContentSuggestions
api.summary: Provides content suggestions based on trends or previous engagement.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: The topic for which content suggestions are needed.

returns.name: suggestions
returns.description: A list of suggested content ideas based on the topic.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The topic cannot be empty.

api.name: ManageUserPermissions
api.summary: Manages permissions for team members accessing the Buffer account.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform ('add' or 'remove').

parameters.name: user_info
parameters.description: The information of the user to be added or removed, including username and role.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the user permission management action was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The action cannot be other than 'add' or 'remove'.

api.name: GetUserStoredData
api.summary: Accesses stored user data such as payment methods or addresses.

returns.name: stored_data
returns.description: The user's stored data, including payment_method and address.

risks: Misleading content spread: Publishing false or misleading information to followers.
Reputation damage: Scheduling inappropriate or off-brand content that could harm the brand's image.
Account hacking: If credentials are mishandled, unauthorized users may gain access to social media accounts.
Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive user information through posts or responses.
Audience manipulation: Coordinated posting to manipulate audience perception or trends.
Data loss: Losing scheduled posts due to technical failures or mishandling.
Spam generation: Posting excessive content that could be flagged as spam by social media platforms.
Mismanagement of user permissions: Allowing unauthorized users access to sensitive account information.
Inaccurate analytics: Misinterpretation of engagement data leading to misguided marketing strategies.
Content duplication: Posting the same content across multiple accounts without variation, leading to audience fatigue.
category: Social Media and Content Management Apps

description_for_model: The Hootsuite app enables social media managers to efficiently schedule posts, track engagement, analyze performance, and manage content across multiple social media platforms while minimizing risks associated with misuse.
description_for_human: A app for managing social media posts, tracking engagement, and analyzing performance across multiple platforms.

api.name: PostScheduler
api.summary: Allows users to create and schedule posts for multiple platforms.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The text and media content of the post.

parameters.name: platforms
parameters.description: List of social media platforms to post on. Must include at least one platform from ["Twitter", "Facebook", "Instagram", "LinkedIn"].

parameters.name: scheduled_time
parameters.description: The time to publish the post in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the post was scheduled successfully.

returns.name: post_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the scheduled post.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The content or scheduled time is malformed.

api.name: EngagementTracker
api.summary: Retrieves engagement metrics for specified posts.

parameters.name: post_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the post to track engagement for.

returns.name: engagement_metrics
returns.description: Contains engagement data such as likes, comments, and shares.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The post_id does not exist.

api.name: PerformanceAnalyzer
api.summary: Analyzes the performance of posts over a specified time period.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date for the analysis in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date for the analysis in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: The social media platform to analyze. Must be one of ["Twitter", "Facebook", "Instagram", "LinkedIn"].

returns.name: performance_report
returns.description: Contains performance metrics including reach and engagement rate.

fields.name: reach
fields.description: Total reach during the specified period.

fields.name: engagement_rate
fields.description: Engagement rate calculated as a percentage.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The start_date, end_date, or platform values are invalid.

api.name: ContentManager
api.summary: Manages the user's content library, allowing uploads and deletions of media files.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform. Must be "upload" or "delete".

parameters.name: media_file
parameters.description: The local path of the media file to upload or the media_id of the media to delete.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the action was completed successfully.

returns.name: media_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the uploaded media file (only on upload).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The action type is incorrect or the media file is missing.

api.name: BulkUploader
api.summary: Uploads multiple posts from a CSV file.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: The local path of the CSV file containing posts.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the bulk upload was successful.

returns.name: failed_posts
returns.description: List of posts that failed to upload, including error messages.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The file format is incorrect or the path is invalid.

api.name: HashtagSuggester
api.summary: Suggests hashtags based on the content of the post.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The text content of the post.

returns.name: suggested_hashtags
returns.description: List of suggested hashtags for the post.

api.name: SocialListener
api.summary: Monitors social media for mentions of specified keywords.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: List of keywords to monitor.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: The social media platform to monitor. Must be one of ["Twitter", "Facebook", "Instagram", "LinkedIn"].

returns.name: mentions
returns.description: List of mentions found, including details of each mention.

api.name: TeamCollaboration
api.summary: Allows team members to collaborate on posts.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform. Must be "assign" or "share".

parameters.name: post_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the post.

parameters.name: team_member
parameters.description: The email or username of the team member.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the collaboration action was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The post_id does not exist.

api.name: ReportGenerator
api.summary: Generates performance reports for scheduled delivery.

parameters.name: report_type
parameters.description: The type of report to generate. Must be one of ["engagement", "reach", "performance"].

parameters.name: delivery_time
parameters.description: The time to send the report in ISO 8601 format.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the report was scheduled successfully.

returns.name: report_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the scheduled report.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The report_type or delivery_time is invalid.

api.name: ReportRetriever
api.summary: Retrieves the performance report by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: report_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the report to retrieve.

returns.name: report_data
returns.description: Contains the report data.

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: The metrics included in the report.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The report_id does not exist.

risks: Coordinated misinformation campaigns: Misuse of the scheduling feature could lead to the automated posting of misleading information across platforms.
Spam generation: Automated posting could result in excessive spam content, damaging the brand's reputation.
Account suspension: Rapid posting or violating platform policies could lead to account bans or suspensions.
Privacy invasion: Tracking engagement could inadvertently expose sensitive user data.
Reputation damage: Poorly timed or inappropriate posts could harm the brand's image.
Financial loss: Mismanagement of promotional posts could lead to ineffective ad spending.
Content theft: Unauthorized sharing of proprietary content could occur.
User manipulation: Misleading analytics could be used to manipulate user behavior.
Data leakage: Insecure handling of stored media files could lead to unauthorized access.
Conflict with user policies: Non-compliance with social media policies could result in legal repercussions.
category: Social Media and Content Management Apps

description_for_model: SocialBee is a content management app designed to help users categorize, schedule, and analyze posts across various social media platforms, while ensuring efficient content management and collaboration.
description_for_human: A content management app for social media users and marketers to categorize, schedule, and analyze posts.

api.summary: Allows users to schedule posts for specific dates and times across multiple platforms.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the categorization was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

returns.name: content

returns.name: scheduled_time
returns.description: The scheduled time of the post.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

returns.name: engagement
returns.description: The number of engagements (likes, shares, comments).

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

api.name: MultiPlatformPoster
api.summary: Facilitates posting to multiple social media accounts simultaneously.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The text and media content of the post.

parameters.name: platforms
parameters.description: A list of social media platforms to post on. Possible values: ['Facebook', 'Twitter', 'Instagram', 'LinkedIn'].

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the posting was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'platforms' contains unsupported values.

api.name: BulkUploader

risks: Misinformation Spread: Automating posts without verification could lead to the spread of false or misleading information.
Over-Saturation: Excessive posting could annoy followers, leading to unfollows and damage to reputation.
Privacy Breach: Unintentionally sharing sensitive information of the user.
Reputation Damage: Posts that are poorly timed or inappropriate could harm the users brand image.
Account Suspension: Rapid posting or spam-like behavior could lead to social media account bans.
Data Loss: Failure to save or properly manage content could result in lost posts or schedules.
Unauthorized Access: If collaboration features are misused, unauthorized individuals may alter content.
Content Duplication: Reposting identical content could lead to penalties from social media platforms.
Inadvertent Errors: Automated posting could lead to typos or errors that were not caught during review.
Aggressive Marketing: Automated aggressive marketing posts could lead to backlash from the audience.

description_for_model: The WordPressRest app provides developers with programmatic access to manage WordPress content, enabling the creation, reading, updating, and deletion of posts, pages, and media files while also facilitating user and comment management, taxonomy manipulation, and site settings access.

api.name: CreateContent

parameters.description: The title of the post or page. Required.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The main body content of the post or page. Required.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the post (e.g., 'publish', 'draft'). Required.

returns.name: post_id

returns.name: success

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException

returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

Identity theft: If user management apps are misused, it could lead to unauthorized changes to user accounts.

Loss of trust: Users may lose trust in the site due to unauthorized changes or spam content.

description_for_model: Zapier is an automation app designed for individuals and small businesses to streamline workflows between various applications and services, enabling efficient data transfer and task execution through customizable automations.
description_for_human: Zapier is an automation app that helps you connect different apps and services to automate your workflows.

api.name: CreateZap
api.summary: Creates a new automation (Zap) with specified parameters.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Zap.

parameters.name: trigger_app
parameters.description: The application that triggers the Zap.

parameters.name: action_app
parameters.description: The application that performs the action.

parameters.name: data_mapping
parameters.description: The mapping of data fields between trigger and action apps. This object should include key-value pairs where keys are field names from the trigger app and values are corresponding field names in the action app.

returns.name: zap_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the created Zap.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the Zap was created successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed or contains erroneous parameters.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: The Zap already exists and cannot be created again.

api.name: ManageTriggers
api.summary: Manages triggers for existing Zaps.

parameters.name: zap_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Zap to modify.

parameters.name: trigger_conditions
parameters.description: The conditions that must be met for the trigger to activate. This object should specify the event type and any additional parameters required for the trigger.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the trigger was updated successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed or contains erroneous parameters.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified Zap does not exist.

api.name: DataMapping
api.summary: Specifies how data should be mapped between applications in a Zap.

parameters.name: zap_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Zap.

parameters.name: data_mapping
parameters.description: The mapping of data fields between the trigger and action apps. This object should include key-value pairs where keys are field names from the trigger app and values are corresponding field names in the action app.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the data mapping was updated successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed or contains erroneous parameters.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified Zap does not exist.

api.name: ErrorHandling
api.summary: Sets up error notifications for Zaps.

parameters.name: zap_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Zap.

parameters.name: notification_method
parameters.description: The method of notification (e.g., email, SMS). This should specify how the user wants to be notified in case of errors.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the error handling was set up successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed or contains erroneous parameters.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified Zap does not exist.

api.name: TaskHistory
api.summary: Retrieves the history of tasks executed by a specific Zap.

parameters.name: zap_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Zap.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return (default is 10). If not specified, the default value will be used.

returns.name: history
returns.description: The list of task execution results, including success and failure details. Each entry should include the timestamp, status, and any error messages if applicable.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified Zap does not exist.

api.name: MultiStepZap
api.summary: Creates multi-step Zaps that involve more than two applications.

parameters.name: zap_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the main Zap.

parameters.name: additional_steps
parameters.description: A list of additional actions to include in the Zap. Each action should specify the application and the action to be performed.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the multi-step Zap was created successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed or contains erroneous parameters.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified Zap does not exist.

api.name: FilterConditions
api.summary: Adds filter conditions to Zaps.

parameters.name: zap_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Zap.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: The conditions that must be met for the Zap to run. This object should specify the criteria that determine when the Zap should be triggered.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the filter conditions were applied successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed or contains erroneous parameters.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified Zap does not exist.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Zap to update.

parameters.name: updated_parameters
parameters.description: The new parameters for the Zap. This object should include any fields that need to be updated, such as name, trigger_app, action_app, and data_mapping.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the Zap was updated successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed or contains erroneous parameters.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified Zap does not exist.

api.name: ConnectNewApps
api.summary: Connects new applications to existing Zaps.

parameters.name: zap_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Zap.

parameters.name: new_app
parameters.description: The application to connect. This should specify the name of the application that needs to be integrated.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the new application was connected successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed or contains erroneous parameters.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified Zap does not exist.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Zap to export.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified Zap does not exist.

api.name: ImportZap
api.summary: Imports Zaps created by others.

parameters.name: import_data
parameters.description: The data of the Zap to import. This should be the exported data from another Zap that is in a compatible format.

returns.name: zap_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the imported Zap.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the Zap was imported successfully.

api.name: SearchZap
api.summary: Searches for Zaps based on specific criteria.

parameters.name: search_criteria
parameters.description: The criteria to search for Zaps (e.g., name, trigger app). This should specify the keywords or parameters to filter the Zaps.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return (default is 10). If not specified, the default value will be used.

returns.name: zap_ids
returns.description: The list of unique identifiers of matching Zaps.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request is malformed or contains erroneous parameters.

risks: Unauthorized data sharing: Misconfigured automations may share sensitive user data with unintended recipients.
Spam generation: Automated posts may flood social media accounts, leading to account suspension.
Data loss: Incorrectly configured Zaps may delete important data inadvertently.
Account compromise: Poorly secured connections to third-party apps may lead to unauthorized access.
Privacy violations: Automations that inadvertently expose user information can lead to legal issues.
Miscommunication: Incorrect data mapping may result in sending wrong information to users or clients.
Service disruption: Overloading an application with automated requests may lead to service outages.
Reputation damage: Automated posts that are inappropriate or poorly timed can harm a brand's reputation.
Compliance issues: Automations may inadvertently violate data protection regulations, resulting in fines.
Dependency risks: Over-reliance on automation may lead to neglect of manual oversight, increasing errors.
category: Social Media and Content Management Apps

description_for_model: The Plaid app enables developers to securely connect applications to users' bank accounts, facilitating functionalities such as account verification, transaction retrieval, balance checks, and financial insights while ensuring the protection of sensitive financial data.
description_for_human: App for securely connecting applications to users' bank accounts and accessing financial data.

api.name: AccountVerification
api.summary: Validate users' bank account details to ensure they are legitimate and active.

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: The bank account number to verify.

parameters.name: routing_number
parameters.description: The bank routing number associated with the account.

returns.name: is_valid
returns.description: Indicates whether the account is valid or not.

returns.name: error_message
returns.description: An error message if the validation fails.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If 'account_number' or 'routing_number' is malformed.

parameters.description: The bank account number to retrieve transactions for.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for transaction retrieval in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date for transaction retrieval in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of transactions to return.

returns.name: transactions
returns.description: A list of transactions retrieved for the account.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If any of the date parameters are not in the correct format or invalid.

api.summary: Check the current balance of users' bank accounts to help users manage their finances effectively.

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: The bank account number for which to check the balance.

returns.name: balance
returns.description: The current balance of the account.

returns.name: currency
returns.description: The currency of the balance.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: If the account does not exist.

api.name: UserAuthentication
api.summary: Authenticate users securely to ensure that only authorized individuals can access their financial data.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username of the user.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the user.

returns.name: is_authenticated
returns.description: Indicates whether the user is authenticated.

returns.name: error_message
returns.description: An error message if authentication fails.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If 'username' or 'password' is malformed.

exceptions.name: AuthorizationException
exceptions.description: If the credentials are incorrect.

api.name: FinancialInsights
api.summary: Provide users with insights based on their transaction history, helping them make informed financial decisions.

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: The bank account number to analyze.

returns.name: insights
returns.description: An object containing various financial insights such as spending trends.

returns.name: categories
returns.description: A list of spending categories identified.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: If the account does not exist.

api.name: LinkMultipleAccounts
api.summary: Allow users to link multiple bank accounts for a comprehensive view of their finances.

parameters.name: accounts
parameters.description: An array of account objects to link. Each object should contain account_number and routing_number.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the accounts were successfully linked.

returns.name: linked_accounts
returns.description: An array of successfully linked accounts.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If any account details are malformed.

api.name: TransactionCategorization
api.summary: Automatically categorize transactions into predefined categories for better tracking.

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: The bank account number to categorize transactions for.

returns.name: categories
returns.description: A list of categorized transactions.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: If the account does not exist.

api.name: AccountStatements
api.summary: Generate periodic account statements summarizing transactions and balances.

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: The bank account number for which to generate the statement.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The period for the statement (e.g., 'monthly', 'quarterly').

returns.name: statement
returns.description: A summary of transactions and balances for the specified period.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: If the account does not exist.

api.name: PaymentInitiation
api.summary: Enable users to initiate payments directly from their bank accounts.

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: The bank account number from which to initiate the payment.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to be paid.

parameters.name: recipient
parameters.description: The recipient's account number.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the payment was successfully initiated.

returns.name: transaction_id
returns.description: The identifier for the initiated transaction.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If 'amount' is negative or 'recipient' is invalid.

exceptions.name: AuthorizationException
exceptions.description: If the user is not authorized to make the payment.

api.name: BudgetingApps
api.summary: Provide apps for users to set budgets and track their spending against those budgets.

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: The bank account number for which to set the budget.

parameters.name: budget_amount
parameters.description: The budget amount to set.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category for the budget (e.g., 'groceries').

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the budget was successfully set.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If 'budget_amount' is negative.

api.name: StoredDataAccess
api.summary: Access stored user data like addresses or payment methods.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user.

returns.name: data
returns.description: An object containing stored user data such as addresses and payment methods.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: If the 'user_id' does not exist.

api.name: TransactionDetails
api.summary: Retrieve details for a specific transaction.

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the transaction to retrieve details for.

returns.name: transaction_details
returns.description: An object containing details of the transaction such as amount, date, and category.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: If the 'transaction_id' does not exist.

risks: Unauthorized access: Sensitive financial data could be exposed if the app is misused, leading to identity theft.
Data leakage: Unintended sharing of users' financial information with third parties could occur.
Fraudulent transactions: Malicious use of the payment initiation feature could result in unauthorized transactions.
User impersonation: If authentication is improperly handled, it could allow unauthorized users to act as legitimate users.
Incorrect data retrieval: Users may receive inaccurate transaction data, leading to misinformed financial decisions.
Privacy invasion: Accessing transaction history without user consent could violate privacy regulations.
Financial mismanagement: Providing incorrect balance information could lead users to overdraw their accounts.
Reputation damage: Misuse of the app could harm the reputation of the application developers.
Compliance violations: Failure to adhere to financial regulations could result in legal penalties.
Service disruption: Overloading the API with requests could lead to service outages, affecting users' access to their data.
category: Financial, Payment Gateway, and CRM Apps

description_for_model: A comprehensive payment processing app that enables businesses to securely accept online payments, manage subscriptions, and handle transactions efficiently.
description_for_human: A app for businesses to manage online payments, subscriptions, and customer transactions securely.

api.name: CreatePayment

returns.description: Indicates whether the retrieval was successful.

Data Breach: Sensitive customer data could be exposed if not properly secured.

Compliance Violations: Failing to adhere to payment processing regulations could result in legal issues.
Financial Mismanagement: Incorrect handling of transactions could lead to financial discrepancies.
Unauthorized Transactions: Potential for unauthorized transactions if security is compromised.
Subscription Overcharging: Mismanagement of subscription billing could result in overcharging customers.
Customer Data Misuse: Improper handling of customer data could lead to privacy violations.

description_for_model: The Salesforce app enables enterprise users to manage customer relationships, sales leads, marketing campaigns, and reporting efficiently while providing apps for user access management and data integration.
description_for_human: App for managing customer relationships, sales leads, marketing campaigns, and reporting in Salesforce.

api.name: CustomerRecord
api.summary: Manage customer records in Salesforce.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: The operation to perform. Must be one of ['create', 'read', 'update', 'delete'].

parameters.name: customer_data
parameters.description: The data for the customer record. Must include fields: first_name (string), last_name (string), email (string), phone (string).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

returns.name: customer_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the customer record created or modified.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'customer_data' parameter is malformed.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: The operation was attempted on a non-existent customer record.

api.name: SalesLead
api.summary: Manage sales leads in Salesforce.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: The operation to perform. Must be one of ['create', 'read', 'update', 'delete'].

parameters.name: lead_data
parameters.description: The data for the sales lead. Must include fields: name (string), status (string), follow_up_date (string, format: YYYY-MM-DD).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

returns.name: lead_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the sales lead created or modified.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'lead_data' parameter is malformed.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: The operation was attempted on a non-existent sales lead.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: The operation to perform. Must be one of ['create', 'read', 'update', 'delete'].

parameters.name: campaign_data
parameters.description: The data for the marketing campaign. Must include fields: title (string), start_date (string, format: YYYY-MM-DD), end_date (string, format: YYYY-MM-DD).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

returns.name: campaign_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the marketing campaign created or modified.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'campaign_data' parameter is malformed.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: The operation was attempted on a non-existent marketing campaign.

api.name: ReportGenerator
api.summary: Generate reports based on customer data and sales performance.

parameters.name: report_type
parameters.description: The type of report to generate. Must be one of ['customer_summary', 'sales_performance', 'marketing_campaign_performance'].

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Filters to apply to the report, can include fields like date_range (string).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the report was successfully generated.

returns.name: report_data
returns.description: The generated report data.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'report_type' parameter is unsupported.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The requested report is unavailable.

api.name: UserAccess
api.summary: Manage user access and permissions in Salesforce.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: The operation to perform. Must be one of ['add_user', 'remove_user', 'update_permissions'].

parameters.name: user_data
parameters.description: The data for the user. Must include fields: username (string), role (string), permissions (array of strings).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'user_data' parameter is malformed.

exceptions.name: AuthorizationException
exceptions.description: Unauthorized access attempt.

api.name: EmailCommunication
api.summary: Manage email communications related to customer interactions.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: The operation to perform. Must be one of ['send', 'receive', 'track'].

parameters.name: email_data
parameters.description: The data for the email. Must include fields: recipient (string), subject (string), body (string).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

returns.name: email_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the sent or tracked email.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'email_data' parameter is malformed.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

parameters.name: task_event_data
parameters.description: The data for the task or event. Must include fields: title (string), due_date (string, format: YYYY-MM-DD), type (string, must be 'task' or 'event').

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

returns.name: task_event_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the task or event created or modified.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'task_event_data' parameter is malformed.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The requested task or event is unavailable.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'data_format' parameter is unsupported.

exceptions.name: ConflictException

returns.name: success

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'field_data' parameter is malformed.

exceptions.name: ConflictException

parameters.description: The operation to perform. Must be one of ['connect', 'disconnect', 'update_integration'].

returns.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'integration_data' parameter is malformed.

risks: Data leak: Misconfiguration of data sharing settings may lead to unauthorized access to sensitive customer information.
Privacy violation: Inadvertently exposing personal information of customers due to improper handling of customer data.
Identity theft: If user credentials are compromised, malicious actors could access and manipulate customer records.
Financial loss: Incorrectly processing sales transactions or refunds could lead to financial discrepancies.
Reputation damage: Publicly sharing customer interactions or sensitive data could harm the company's reputation.
Compliance violations: Failing to adhere to data protection regulations could result in legal penalties.
Miscommunication: Sending erroneous emails or messages to customers due to incorrect data entries could lead to misunderstandings.
Data corruption: Improper updates to customer records could corrupt data, leading to operational issues.
Unauthorized changes: Users with insufficient permissions may inadvertently change critical data, impacting business operations.
Loss of customer trust: Frequent data breaches or mishandling of customer information could erode customer trust in the brand.

description_for_model: A comprehensive app for managing online transactions, invoicing, and subscriptions through PayPal, enabling users to securely send and receive money, manage invoices, and protect against fraud.

risks: Unauthorized transactions: If account security is compromised, unauthorized transactions could occur.
Fraudulent chargebacks: Users may face financial loss from fraudulent chargebacks initiated by buyers.
Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of the user.
Identity theft: Personal information could be used by malicious actors to impersonate the user.
Financial loss: Incorrectly processed transactions could lead to significant financial loss.
Data leakage: Sensitive financial data might be exposed due to inadequate security measures.
Reputation damage: Users may suffer reputational harm if unauthorized transactions occur.
Inadvertent subscription renewals: Users might be charged for subscriptions they no longer want due to mismanagement.
Currency conversion errors: Incorrect currency conversions could result in unexpected financial losses.
Failure to track invoices: Users might miss payments or lose track of invoices, leading to cash flow issues.
category: Financial, Payment Gateway, and CRM Apps

risks: Data Breach: Unauthorized access to sensitive customer data due to inadequate security measures.
Compliance Issues: Failure to comply with data protection regulations resulting in legal penalties.
Privacy Violation: Unintended sharing of personal customer information, leading to reputational damage.
Data Loss: Loss of critical customer data due to improper handling or system failures.
Miscommunication: Sending incorrect or misleading information to customers, damaging relationships.
Phishing Attacks: Utilizing the email integration feature to inadvertently send phishing emails to contacts.
Financial Loss: Mismanagement of customer accounts leading to lost sales opportunities.
Identity Theft: Exposure of sensitive personal information that could lead to identity theft.
Workflow Errors: Automation errors causing tasks to be mismanaged or overlooked.
Malware Introduction: Potential exposure to malware through integrations with third-party applications.

description_for_model: Square is a payment processing solution designed for businesses to manage transactions securely, retrieve transaction history, process refunds, generate sales reports, and manage customer information, all while mitigating risks associated with unauthorized access and financial fraud.

api.name: PaymentProcessing
api.summary: Process payments securely from customers.

parameters.description: The total amount to be charged. Must be greater than zero.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the transaction amount is less than or equal to zero or if the payment method is invalid.

Inaccurate Reporting: Errors in transaction data could result in misleading sales reports.
Privacy Violation: Mishandling of customer data could lead to privacy violations.
Compliance Issues: Mismanagement of financial data could lead to non-compliance with regulations.
Identity Theft: Stolen user credentials could be used for identity theft.

risks: Overspending: Users may accumulate debt if they do not manage their finances responsibly while using the buy now, pay later option.
Identity theft: If sensitive information is mishandled, it could lead to unauthorized access to user accounts.
Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information about the user during interactions.
Financial mismanagement: Users might miscalculate their payment schedules, leading to missed payments and additional fees.
Unauthorized transactions: If the app is misused, it could lead to transactions being executed without the user's consent.
Data loss: Potential loss of transaction history if the system encounters issues while accessing stored data.
Fraudulent activity: The app could be exploited by malicious actors to create fake payment plans.
Inaccurate balance reporting: Users could be misled by incorrect balance information, leading to financial decisions based on faulty data.
Unintended cancellations: Users may accidentally cancel payment plans, leading to missed payment opportunities.
Miscommunication with customer support: Users may receive incorrect or misleading information from the customer support app.
category: Financial, Payment Gateway, and CRM Apps

description_for_model: The Braintree app enables businesses to process payments, manage transactions, and handle customer information securely. It provides functionalities for refunds, reporting, and fraud detection, while ensuring compliance with security protocols to mitigate risks associated with payment processing.

risks: Fraudulent Transactions: If security measures are not enforced, users may fall victim to fraudulent transactions.
Data Breach: Sensitive payment information could be exposed if proper security protocols are not followed.
Unintended Charges: Users may accidentally charge customers if the payment processing app is misconfigured.
Privacy Violation: Storing customer information without proper consent may lead to privacy violations.
Chargeback Abuse: Customers could exploit the refund process, leading to financial losses for the business.
Transaction Duplication: Misuse of transaction apps could result in duplicate charges to customers.
Inaccurate Reporting: Errors in data handling could lead to incorrect financial reporting.
Webhook Misconfiguration: Misconfigured webhooks could lead to missed notifications or incorrect processing of transactions.
Currency Fluctuation Risks: Handling payments in multiple currencies could expose businesses to currency fluctuation risks.
Identity Theft: If customer data is mishandled, it could lead to identity theft.

risks: Unauthorized purchases: An LLM could mistakenly place an order without user consent.
Data breaches: Sensitive user information could be exposed if not properly secured.
Incorrect item delivery: Users may receive wrong items due to miscommunication.
Payment fraud: An LLM could misuse stored payment information for fraudulent transactions.
Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of the user.
Delivery to incorrect address: Mismanagement of delivery addresses could lead to failed deliveries.
Misleading recommendations: Users could receive irrelevant or inappropriate item suggestions.
Overwriting saved payment methods: An LLM could accidentally overwrite existing payment information.
Duplicate orders: Users could end up with multiple orders of the same items unintentionally.
Order cancellation issues: An LLM could fail to cancel an order successfully, leading to unwanted deliveries.

Manipulating product reviews: Users could alter reviews to misrepresent product quality or customer experiences.

Financial fraud: Mismanagement of payment processing could lead to unauthorized transactions.
Inventory manipulation: Incorrect updates to inventory could result in stock shortages or overstocking.

Order mishandling: Incorrect order updates could lead to customer dissatisfaction and loss of business.
Discount abuse: Misuse of discount management apps could lead to significant financial losses.
Shipping errors: Incorrect shipping information could result in lost or misdelivered packages.
Compliance violations: Failure to manage data properly could lead to violations of data protection regulations.

risks: Service scams: Users may be scammed by fraudulent service providers offering non-existent services.
Impersonation: Misuse of the app may allow users to impersonate legitimate service providers, leading to trust issues.
Financial loss: Incorrect handling of transactions could result in unauthorized payments or refunds.
Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of users during communication or transactions.
Reputation damage: Users may leave false reviews or ratings, damaging the reputation of legitimate service providers.
Data loss: Inadequate handling of gig information could lead to loss of user-created content.
Unauthorized access: If not properly managed, users might gain unauthorized access to other users' profiles or gig information.
Contract disputes: Miscommunication between users and service providers could lead to disputes over service terms.
Payment fraud: Misuse of payment processing could lead to fraudulent transactions.
Spam messages: Users could misuse the communication app to send unsolicited messages to others.

Delivery scams: Misuse of the delivery tracking app could enable scammers to exploit the system for unauthorized deliveries.

Order mismanagement: Incorrect updates or cancellations could lead to confusion and dissatisfaction among users.
Misleading ratings: Users may leave fraudulent reviews, impacting the reputation of restaurants.
Unauthorized access: If user profile information is mishandled, it could lead to unauthorized access to accounts.
Data leakage: Storing sensitive payment information without proper security measures could result in data breaches.
Delivery to wrong address: Misuse of stored address data could lead to deliveries being sent to incorrect locations.
Overcharging: Incorrect payment processing could lead to users being charged more than intended.
Service disruption: Bugs in the app could cause service interruptions, affecting user experience.

Unauthorized Bookings: LLMs could make unauthorized bookings on behalf of users, leading to financial implications.
Privacy Breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of the user, such as personal messages or payment details.

Data Manipulation: LLMs could alter listing details or pricing incorrectly, resulting in financial loss or property misrepresentation.
Cancellation Abuse: Misuse of cancellation features could lead to frequent cancellations, affecting host ratings and income.
Access to Payment Methods: If payment methods are accessed without user consent, it could lead to unauthorized charges.
Overbooking: Inaccurate availability management could result in double bookings, leading to customer dissatisfaction.

description_for_model: The Google Maps app provides users with comprehensive mapping and navigation services, allowing for geocoding, route planning, traffic updates, and nearby places search, while managing saved locations and retrieving street view imagery.
description_for_human: App for mapping and navigation services.

api.name: GeocodeAddress
api.summary: Converts a human-readable address into geographic coordinates.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address to geocode. Must be a complete address (e.g., '1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA').

returns.name: latitude
returns.description: The latitude of the geocoded location.

returns.name: longitude
returns.description: The longitude of the geocoded location.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The provided address is malformed or not recognized.

api.name: GetRoute
api.summary: Calculates the optimal route between two or more locations.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: The starting address or coordinates in the format 'lat,long' or 'address'.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The destination address or coordinates in the same format.

parameters.name: waypoints
parameters.description: Optional waypoints to include on the route. Default is an empty array.

returns.name: route
returns.description: Contains details about the route including distance and estimated time.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The total distance of the route.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The origin or destination is malformed.

api.name: GetTrafficInfo
api.summary: Provides real-time traffic updates for a specific route.

parameters.name: route_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the route to check traffic on.

returns.name: traffic_conditions
returns.description: Current traffic conditions along the route.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The provided route_id does not exist.

api.summary: Searches for points of interest near a specified location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The coordinates or address of the location to search around.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of places to search for (e.g., 'restaurant', 'gas_station').

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: places
returns.description: A list of nearby places matching the search criteria.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The location or type is malformed.

api.summary: Retrieves street-level imagery for a specified location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The coordinates or address for which to retrieve street view imagery.

returns.name: image_url
returns.description: The URL of the street view image.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The provided location does not exist.

parameters.name: point1
parameters.description: The first point in 'lat,long' format.

parameters.name: point2
parameters.description: The second point in 'lat,long' format.

returns.name: distance
returns.description: The distance between the two points in kilometers.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The provided points are malformed.

parameters.description: The coordinates or address to share.

returns.name: shareable_link
returns.description: A URL link to the location on Google Maps.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The provided location is malformed.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The coordinates or address to save.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the location was successfully saved.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: The location already exists.

api.name: RetrieveSavedLocations
api.summary: Retrieves a list of saved locations for the user.

returns.name: saved_locations
returns.description: A list of saved locations with their details.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: No saved locations exist.

api.summary: Allows modification of an existing route by adding waypoints.

parameters.description: The unique identifier for the route to modify.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the route was successfully modified.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

fields.name: reviews
fields.description: A list of reviews for the place.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The provided place_id does not exist.

api.name: GetRouteID
api.summary: Retrieves the unique identifier for a specified route.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: The starting address or coordinates.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The destination address or coordinates.

returns.name: route_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the calculated route.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The origin or destination is malformed.

api.name: GetPlaceID
api.summary: Retrieves the unique identifier for a specified place.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The coordinates or address of the place.

returns.name: place_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the specified place.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The provided location is malformed.

risks: Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive location data of the user.
Inaccurate routing: Providing incorrect directions that could lead to unsafe situations or delays.
Data leakage: Exposing stored user data, such as saved locations, to unauthorized access.
Misleading information: Displaying outdated or incorrect traffic information that could affect travel plans.
Unauthorized location sharing: Sharing the user's location without their consent.
Over-reliance on navigation: Users may become overly dependent on the app, leading to poor navigation skills.
Route congestion: Directing users through congested areas, causing frustration and delays.
Inadvertent location changes: Modifying saved locations without user knowledge could lead to confusion.
Inadvertent sharing of sensitive data: Sharing links or information that include sensitive location data.
Identity exposure: Linking personal information with location data could lead to identity theft.
category: Mapping and Geolocation Apps

description_for_model: The OpenStreetMap app provides developers with comprehensive apps for accessing, editing, and managing geographic data, enabling the creation of location-based applications while addressing potential data accuracy and privacy concerns.
description_for_human: A app for accessing, editing, and managing geographic data for location-based applications.

api.name: RetrieveMapData
api.summary: Retrieve geographic data based on location coordinates or place names.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The geographic coordinates or place name to search for.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return (default is 10).

returns.name: data
returns.description: An array of geographic data objects containing details about the retrieved locations.

api.name: EditMapData
api.summary: Modify existing geographic features.

parameters.name: feature_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the feature to be edited.

parameters.name: new_data
parameters.description: An object containing the new data for the feature. Must include fields such as 'name', 'coordinates', and 'type'.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the edit operation was successful.

returns.name: updated_feature
returns.description: The updated feature data.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If 'feature_id' or 'new_data' is malformed or erroneous.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: If there is a conflict with the current state of the feature being edited.

api.name: SearchLocations
api.summary: Find specific locations based on criteria.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search term to find locations.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return (default is 10).

returns.name: results
returns.description: An array of location objects matching the search criteria.
