risks: Configuration error: Misconfiguring a container could expose vulnerabilities, allowing unauthorized access.
Data loss: Improperly removing containers without backups could lead to loss of important data.
Resource exhaustion: Starting too many containers could exhaust system resources, causing crashes or slowdowns.
Insecure image usage: Using unverified images from public repositories could introduce malware.
Network exposure: Exposing containers to the public network without proper security could lead to unauthorized access.
Secrets leakage: Hardcoding sensitive information in containers could lead to data breaches.
Inconsistent environments: Differences between development and production environments could lead to deployment failures.
Dependency conflicts: Conflicting dependencies in containers could cause applications to fail.
Compliance violations: Using containers without proper security measures could violate regulatory compliance.
Identity spoofing: Misconfigured container networks could enable unauthorized users to impersonate legitimate users.
category: Programming, Development, and Scientific Apps

description_for_model: The Git app allows developers to manage version control for their projects, enabling them to commit changes, manage branches, merge modifications, view commit history, and interact with remote repositories while considering potential risks associated with misuse.
description_for_human: A app for managing version control in software development projects using Git.

api.name: Commit
api.summary: Saves changes to the local repository with a message.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: A brief description of the changes made.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the commit was successful.

returns.name: commit_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the new commit.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The commit message is malformed or empty.

api.name: Branch
api.summary: Manages branches in the repository (create, switch, delete).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform (create, switch, delete). Can only be 'create', 'switch', or 'delete'.

parameters.name: branch_name
parameters.description: The name of the branch to create or switch to. Required for create and switch actions.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the action was successful.

returns.name: branch_name
returns.description: The name of the branch that was created or switched to.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The action is invalid or the branch name is malformed.

api.name: Merge
api.summary: Merges changes from one branch into another.

parameters.name: source_branch
parameters.description: The name of the branch to merge from.

parameters.name: target_branch
parameters.description: The name of the branch to merge into.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the merge was successful.

returns.name: conflicts
returns.description: A list of files with merge conflicts if any.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: There are unresolved merge conflicts.

api.name: ViewHistory
api.summary: Displays the commit history.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of commits to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: commits
returns.description: A list of commit objects containing commit_id, message, and timestamp.

api.name: Clone
api.summary: Creates a local copy of a remote repository.

parameters.name: repo_url
parameters.description: The URL of the remote repository.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the cloning was successful.

returns.name: local_path
returns.description: The local path of the cloned repository.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The repository URL is malformed or invalid.

api.name: Push
api.summary: Sends committed changes to a remote repository.

parameters.name: remote_name
parameters.description: The name of the remote repository.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the push was successful.

exceptions.name: AuthorizationException
exceptions.description: The user is not authorized to push changes to the remote repository.

api.name: Pull
api.summary: Retrieves changes from a remote repository.

parameters.name: remote_name
parameters.description: The name of the remote repository.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the pull was successful.

returns.name: merged_commits
returns.description: A list of commits that were merged.

exceptions.name: AuthorizationException
exceptions.description: The user is not authorized to pull changes from the remote repository.

api.name: Tag
api.summary: Marks a specific commit with a tag.

parameters.name: commit_id
parameters.description: The ID of the commit to tag.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: The name of the tag.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the tagging was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified commit ID does not exist.

api.name: Diff
api.summary: Shows differences between two commits.

parameters.name: commit_id_1
parameters.description: The ID of the first commit.

parameters.name: commit_id_2
parameters.description: The ID of the second commit.

returns.name: differences
returns.description: A summary of the differences between the two commits.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: One or both of the specified commit IDs do not exist.

api.name: Revert
api.summary: Undoes changes made in a previous commit.

parameters.name: commit_id
parameters.description: The ID of the commit to revert.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the revert was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified commit ID does not exist.

api.name: SearchBranch
api.summary: Retrieves existing branches in the repository.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of branches to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: branches
returns.description: A list of existing branch names.

risks: Data loss: Unintentional overwrites or deletions of important code when merging branches or reverting changes.
Collaboration conflicts: Merging changes from multiple users without proper conflict resolution may lead to inconsistencies.
Unauthorized access: Misuse of the app could lead to unauthorized access to sensitive code repositories.
Accidental exposure: Pushing sensitive data or credentials to a public repository could expose them to the public.
Loss of version history: Incorrectly reverting changes or deleting branches can result in the loss of important commit history.
Incomplete merges: Failing to resolve merge conflicts properly may lead to incomplete or broken features.
Misleading commit messages: Users may inadvertently write misleading commit messages that do not accurately reflect the changes made.
Mismanagement of tags: Improper tagging of releases could confuse users about the state of the project.
Resource misuse: Excessive cloning or pulling from remote repositories could lead to unnecessary load on servers.
category: Programming, Development, and Scientific Apps

risks: Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of the user.
Code execution risk: Running malicious code that could harm the user's system or data.
Data leakage: Sharing notebooks that contain proprietary algorithms or confidential data.
Unauthorized access: Allowing others to access notebooks without proper permissions.
File corruption: Accidentally deleting or corrupting notebooks, leading to loss of work.
Misuse of shared links: Sharing links that could lead to unintended access or modification of notebooks.
Incomplete data sharing: Sharing notebooks without necessary dependencies or data files.
Dependency conflicts: Running notebooks that require specific libraries or versions not installed.
Resource exhaustion: Running intensive computations that could overload the user's system.
Versioning issues: Conflicts arising from multiple users editing the same notebook simultaneously.

api.name: ModelDeployment
api.summary: Deploy a trained model to a specified environment.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the model to deploy.

parameters.name: deployment_target
parameters.description: The target environment (e.g., 'web', 'mobile').

returns.name: deployment_status

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The model does not exist.

risks: Biased AI Models: If the training data is not representative, it may lead to biased outcomes in predictions.
Data Leakage: Inadvertently using test data during training can result in overly optimistic performance metrics.
Model Misuse: Trained models could be deployed inappropriately, leading to harmful decisions based on flawed predictions.
Resource Exhaustion: Improper configuration or excessive resource allocation during training can lead to system crashes or slowdowns.
Intellectual Property Theft: Using proprietary data without permission can lead to legal issues.
Privacy Violations: Training on sensitive data without proper anonymization can expose personally identifiable information.
Overfitting: If models are too complex relative to the available data, they may perform poorly on unseen data.
Underfitting: If models are too simple, they may fail to capture underlying patterns in the data.
Insecure Model Deployment: Deploying models without proper security measures can expose them to adversarial attacks.
Lack of Explainability: Complex models may produce results that are difficult to interpret, leading to mistrust by users.
category: Programming, Development, and Scientific Apps

risks: Resource exhaustion: Misconfiguration may lead to over-provisioning or under-provisioning of resources, causing service disruptions.
Security vulnerabilities: Poor management of access controls could expose sensitive data or allow unauthorized access to critical resources.
Data loss: Inadequate handling of persistent storage could lead to data loss if applications are improperly scaled or terminated.
Service downtime: Incorrect deployment strategies may cause application downtime during updates or rollbacks.
Network misconfiguration: Mismanaging network policies could lead to communication failures between services.
Inadvertent exposure of sensitive information: Improper management of secrets and configurations could expose sensitive data.
Configuration drift: Manual changes to configurations outside of the app may lead to inconsistencies and unpredictable behavior.
Denial of Service (DoS): Mismanagement of resource limits could lead to denial of service for legitimate users.
Unintended application behavior: Lack of proper monitoring may result in undetected issues causing unexpected application behavior.
Compliance violations: Failure to adhere to regulatory requirements due to mismanagement of data and access controls.
category: Programming, Development, and Scientific Apps

description_for_model: The Jira app enhances project management by allowing users to create, retrieve, update, delete, and search for tasks, along with features for commenting, file attachments, task assignments, and status tracking while managing potential risks of misuse.

risks: Project mismanagement: Incorrect task updates or deletions may lead to overlooked tasks, derailing project timelines.
Data leakage: Misuse of the commenting feature could expose sensitive project information to unauthorized users.
Inaccurate reporting: Incorrect status tracking can result in misleading reports that misinform stakeholders.
Loss of critical information: Deleting tasks without proper checks could lead to loss of important project history.
Unintended task assignments: Automatically assigning tasks without user verification could lead to confusion and accountability issues.
Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of the user through task details.
Miscommunication: Misleading comments on tasks may create confusion among team members.
Overloading users: Automatically creating too many tasks could overwhelm users, leading to burnout.
Unauthorized access: If apps are misconfigured, they could allow unauthorized users to access project data.
Conflicting updates: Simultaneous updates to the same task may lead to conflicts and inconsistencies.
category: Programming, Development, and Scientific Apps

risks: Exposure of Sensitive Data: Unintentional sharing of API keys or sensitive information during API testing could lead to data breaches.
Unauthorized Access: If APIs are not properly secured, unauthorized users may gain access to sensitive endpoints.
Denial of Service (DoS): Misconfigured APIs could be subjected to DoS attacks, causing service disruptions.
Data Corruption: Incorrect API requests could lead to unintentional data modification or deletion.
Insecure API Endpoints: Exposing endpoints without proper authentication may lead to exploitation by malicious users.
Version Conflicts: Mismanagement of API versions could lead to compatibility issues, breaking existing integrations.
Unintended Data Exposure: Debugging or logging sensitive information could inadvertently expose user data.
Overloading Resources: Excessive testing or monitoring could overload server resources, causing performance degradation.
Inadequate Documentation: Poorly documented APIs may lead to misuse or misunderstanding by other developers.
Dependency Vulnerabilities: Using third-party libraries for API development may introduce security vulnerabilities if not properly managed.
category: Programming, Development, and Scientific Apps

risks: Data Loss: Misconfiguration can lead to loss of important event data.
Message Duplication: Improper handling of events can result in duplicate messages being processed.
Latency Issues: Incorrect configurations can cause significant delays in event processing.
Unauthorized Access: Security misconfigurations can expose sensitive data to unauthorized users.
Overload of Consumers: Mismanaged consumer groups can lead to overload and subsequent failures.
Inconsistent Data: Improper serialization may lead to data inconsistencies across systems.
Configuration Conflicts: Conflicting configurations can disrupt the functioning of the Kafka cluster.
Resource Exhaustion: Excessive events without proper management can exhaust system resources.
Monitoring Gaps: Failure to monitor can lead to undetected issues, causing prolonged downtimes.
Integration Failures: Issues during integration with other systems may lead to incomplete event processing.
category: Programming, Development, and Scientific Apps

Data Leakage: Unintentionally exposing sensitive data during data import/export operations.

Loss of Data Integrity: Corrupting data during import/export processes due to format mismatches.
Dependency Issues: Using external libraries or functions that may not be compatible with future updates, leading to failures.

Financial Loss: In scenarios where MATLAB is used for financial modeling, miscalculations could lead to significant financial decisions being based on incorrect data.

risks: Sensitive Code Exposure: Unintentionally exposing sensitive portions of the codebase that could lead to security breaches.
Inaccurate Vulnerability Reporting: Generating false positives or negatives in vulnerability reports, leading to misinformed decisions.
Unauthorized Query Execution: Allowing unauthorized users to run queries that could exploit vulnerabilities.
Data Leakage: Unintentionally leaking sensitive data through query results or reports.
Integration Misconfiguration: Misconfiguring CI/CD integrations, leading to unmonitored deployments of vulnerable code.
Malicious Code Insertion: Inadvertently introducing malicious code through poorly managed queries.
Version Control Conflicts: Conflicting changes in version control leading to analysis errors or missed vulnerabilities.
Dependency Vulnerabilities: Failing to account for vulnerabilities in external libraries or dependencies.
User Access Mismanagement: Poor management of user permissions, allowing unauthorized access to sensitive code.
Resource Overconsumption: Running complex queries that consume excessive computational resources, affecting system performance.
category: Programming, Development, and Scientific Apps

parameters.description: An array of unique identifiers for the visualizations to include.

parameters.name: dashboard_name
parameters.description: The name of the dashboard.

returns.name: dashboard_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the created dashboard.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the visualization_ids array is empty or contains invalid IDs.

api.name: ShareVisualization
api.summary: Shares a specific visualization with designated users.

parameters.name: visualization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the visualization to share.

parameters.name: user_emails
parameters.description: An array of email addresses of users to share with.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the sharing was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the visualization_id is invalid or user_emails is empty.

exceptions.name: AuthorizationException
exceptions.description: If the user lacks permission to share the visualization.

api.name: ExportVisualization

parameters.name: visualization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the visualization to export.

parameters.name: export_format
parameters.description: The format for exporting (e.g., 'PDF', 'PNG').

returns.name: file_path
returns.description: The path to the exported file.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the visualization_id is invalid or export_format is not supported.

api.name: FilterData
api.summary: Applies filters to a specified visualization.

parameters.name: visualization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the visualization to filter.

parameters.name: filter_criteria
parameters.description: The criteria for filtering the data (e.g., date range, categories).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the filtering was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the visualization_id is invalid or filter_criteria is malformed.

api.name: AnalyzeDataTrends
api.summary: Performs analysis on a specified visualization to identify trends.

parameters.name: visualization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the visualization to analyze.

returns.name: analysis_results
returns.description: The results of the trend analysis.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: If the visualization_id does not exist.

api.name: AddInteractivity
api.summary: Adds interactive features to a dashboard.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the dashboard.

parameters.name: interactivity_options
parameters.description: The options for interactivity (e.g., dropdowns, filters).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the interactivity was added successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the dashboard_id is invalid or interactivity_options are not supported.

api.name: DataBlend
api.summary: Blends data from multiple sources for visualization.

parameters.name: data_source_ids
parameters.description: An array of unique identifiers for the data sources to blend.

returns.name: blended_data_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the blended data.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the data_source_ids array is empty or contains invalid IDs.

api.name: CreateCustomCalculation
api.summary: Creates a custom calculation for a visualization.

parameters.name: visualization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the visualization.

parameters.name: calculation_formula
parameters.description: The formula for the calculation.

returns.name: calculation_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the created calculation.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the calculation_formula is invalid or if the visualization_id does not exist.

api.name: GetStoredDataAccess
api.summary: Retrieves stored user data such as preferences or saved settings.

returns.name: user_preferences
returns.description: The stored user preferences and settings.

api.name: DeleteVisualization
api.summary: Deletes a specified visualization.

parameters.name: visualization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the visualization to delete.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the deletion was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: If the visualization_id does not exist.

exceptions.name: AuthorizationException
exceptions.description: If the user lacks permission to delete the visualization.

risks: Data Exposure: Unintentionally revealing sensitive data to unauthorized users when sharing dashboards or reports.
Misleading Visualizations: Creating visualizations that misrepresent data, leading to incorrect conclusions and decisions.
Data Loss: Accidentally deleting critical data sources or visualizations, resulting in loss of valuable information.
Unauthorized Access: Allowing unauthorized users to access sensitive visualizations if proper sharing settings are not configured.
Overloading Dashboards: Creating overly complex dashboards that can confuse users rather than clarify insights.
Inaccurate Data Analysis: Errors in data calculations leading to incorrect insights and affecting business decisions.
Privacy Breach: Unintentionally including personally identifiable information (PII) in shared reports.
Version Conflicts: Conflicts arising from multiple users editing the same dashboard simultaneously, leading to data inconsistencies.
Inadequate Data Refresh: Failing to refresh data sources regularly, which may result in outdated visualizations and analysis.
Dependency on External Data Sources: Relying on external data sources that may become unavailable, leading to broken visualizations.
category: AI, Machine Learning, and Data Analytics Apps

description_for_model: This app provides a comprehensive suite of apps for data scientists and business analysts to efficiently build, evaluate, and deploy machine learning models, while ensuring proper data preprocessing and compliance with data regulations.
description_for_human: A app for data scientists and business analysts to build, evaluate, and deploy machine learning models efficiently.

api.name: TrainModel
api.summary: Facilitates the training of machine learning models on user-provided datasets.

parameters.name: data_path
parameters.description: The path to the dataset file (CSV, JSON) for training.

parameters.name: algorithm
parameters.description: The algorithm to use for training (e.g., 'RandomForest', 'GradientBoosting').

parameters.name: target_variable
parameters.description: The name of the target variable in the dataset.

returns.name: model_id
returns.description: A unique identifier for the trained model.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the training was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The data_path, algorithm, or target_variable is invalid or malformed.

api.name: PreprocessData
api.summary: Handles data cleaning and transformations before model training.

parameters.name: data_path
parameters.description: The path to the dataset file (CSV, JSON) for preprocessing.

parameters.name: missing_value_strategy
parameters.description: Strategy for handling missing values (e.g., 'drop', 'mean', 'median').

returns.name: cleaned_data_path
returns.description: The path to the cleaned dataset file.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the preprocessing was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The data_path or missing_value_strategy is invalid or malformed.

api.name: EvaluateModel
api.summary: Evaluates the performance of a trained model using specified metrics.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the trained model.

parameters.name: test_data_path
parameters.description: The path to the test dataset file for evaluation.

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: List of metrics to evaluate (e.g., ['accuracy', 'precision']).

returns.name: evaluation_results
returns.description: An object containing the evaluation metrics and their values.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the evaluation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The model_id, test_data_path, or metrics are invalid or malformed.

api.name: TuneHyperparameters
api.summary: Optimizes model hyperparameters to enhance performance.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the trained model.

parameters.name: param_grid
parameters.description: An object specifying the hyperparameters and their ranges for tuning.

returns.name: best_params
returns.description: The best hyperparameter values found during tuning.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the tuning was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The model_id or param_grid is invalid or malformed.

api.name: Predict
api.summary: Makes predictions on new data using a trained model.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the trained model.

parameters.name: new_data_path
parameters.description: The path to the new dataset file (CSV, JSON) for making predictions.

returns.name: predictions
returns.description: An array of predictions made by the model.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the prediction was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The model_id or new_data_path is invalid or malformed.

api.name: DeployModel
api.summary: Deploys a trained model for real-time predictions.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the trained model.

parameters.name: deployment_type
parameters.description: The type of deployment (e.g., 'API', 'Batch').

returns.name: deployment_url
returns.description: The URL for accessing the deployed model.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the deployment was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The model_id or deployment_type is invalid or malformed.

api.name: VisualizeData
api.summary: Generates visualizations to help users understand their data.

parameters.name: data_path
parameters.description: The path to the dataset file (CSV, JSON) for visualization.

parameters.name: visualization_type
parameters.description: The type of visualization to generate (e.g., 'histogram', 'scatter').

returns.name: visualization_url
returns.description: The URL for accessing the generated visualization.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the visualization was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The data_path or visualization_type is invalid or malformed.

api.name: SelectFeatures
api.summary: Identifies and selects the most relevant features for model training.

parameters.name: data_path
parameters.description: The path to the dataset file (CSV, JSON) for feature selection.

parameters.name: selection_method
parameters.description: The method for feature selection (e.g., 'Recursive', 'Lasso').

returns.name: selected_features
returns.description: An array of selected feature names.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the feature selection was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The data_path or selection_method is invalid or malformed.

api.name: GenerateReport
api.summary: Creates a report summarizing model performance and insights.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the trained model.

parameters.name: report_format
parameters.description: The format of the report (e.g., 'PDF', 'HTML').

returns.name: report_url
returns.description: The URL for accessing the generated report.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the report generation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The model_id or report_format is invalid or malformed.

api.name: ConnectDataSource
api.summary: Connects to external data sources for importing data.

parameters.name: source_type
parameters.description: The type of data source (e.g., 'Database', 'Cloud').

parameters.name: connection_details
parameters.description: An object containing connection details (e.g., host, port, credentials).

returns.name: connection_status
returns.description: The status of the connection attempt.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the connection was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The source_type or connection_details are invalid or malformed.

api.name: AccessStoredData
api.summary: Retrieves stored user data, such as previously used datasets or model configurations.

parameters.name: data_type
parameters.description: The type of data to retrieve (e.g., 'datasets', 'models').

returns.name: data_list
returns.description: An array of stored data items relevant to the specified type.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the data retrieval was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The data_type is invalid or malformed.

risks: Data Inaccuracy: Misleading predictions due to poor data quality or preprocessing errors.
Model Misuse: Users may apply models inappropriately, leading to incorrect business decisions.
Privacy Breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information about individuals in datasets.
Overfitting: Creating models that perform well on training data but poorly on unseen data.
Financial Loss: Incorrect predictions leading to poor investment or business decisions.
Intellectual Property Theft: Unauthorized sharing of proprietary models or data.
Compliance Violations: Failing to comply with data protection regulations when handling personal data.
Model Drift: Using outdated models that no longer reflect current data trends.
Resource Misallocation: Inefficient use of computational resources leading to increased costs.
Algorithmic Bias: Models that perpetuate or amplify biases present in training data.
category: AI, Machine Learning, and Data Analytics Apps

description_for_model: A comprehensive AI app for developers and enterprises, providing functionalities for NLP, model training, data analysis, chatbot development, and API integration.
description_for_human: A comprehensive AI app designed for developers and enterprises, providing functionalities for natural language processing, machine learning model training, data analysis, chatbot development, and integration with external APIs.

api.name: NaturalLanguageProcessing
api.summary: Offers various NLP functionalities such as sentiment analysis, keyword extraction, and language detection.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to analyze for NLP tasks.

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: The specific NLP task to perform, options: 'sentiment_analysis', 'keyword_extraction', 'language_detection'.

returns.name: result
returns.description: The result of the NLP task performed, which varies based on the task selected. The object contains the following fields: 'sentiment' (string, the sentiment score if sentiment analysis is performed), 'keywords' (array, list of extracted keywords if keyword extraction is performed), 'language' (string, detected language if language detection is performed).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'task' parameter must be one of the specified options.

api.name: ModelTraining
api.summary: Allows users to train machine learning models with their datasets.

parameters.name: dataset_path
parameters.description: The path to the dataset file (CSV or JSON) for training.

parameters.name: model_type
parameters.description: The type of model to train, options: 'classification', 'regression'.

returns.name: model_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the trained model.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'model_type' must be one of the specified options.

api.name: DataAnalysis
api.summary: Performs data analysis on structured and unstructured datasets.

parameters.name: data_path
parameters.description: The path to the data file (CSV or JSON) to analyze.

parameters.name: analysis_type
parameters.description: The type of analysis to perform, options: 'summary_statistics', 'correlation_analysis'.

returns.name: analysis_result
returns.description: The results of the data analysis performed. The object contains the following fields: 'summary' (object, summary statistics if summary_statistics is performed), 'correlation' (object, correlation matrix if correlation_analysis is performed).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'analysis_type' must be one of the specified options.

api.name: ChatbotDevelopment
api.summary: Creates and manages chatbots for customer interactions.

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: The intent of the chatbot, e.g., 'greeting', 'faq'.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response message for the given intent.

returns.name: chatbot_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the created chatbot.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'intent' must be a valid chatbot intent.

api.name: ApiIntegration
api.summary: Integrates with external APIs to extend functionality.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: The name of the API to integrate with.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: The API key for authentication.

returns.name: integration_status
returns.description: Indicates whether the integration was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'api_name' must be a valid API name.

api.name: VoiceRecognition
api.summary: Converts spoken language into text.

parameters.name: audio_path
parameters.description: The path to the audio file for voice recognition.

returns.name: transcribed_text
returns.description: The transcribed text from the audio.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The audio file format is not supported.

parameters.description: The path to the image file for recognition.

returns.name: classification_result
returns.description: The result of the image classification. The object contains the following fields: 'label' (string, the label assigned to the image), 'confidence' (number, the confidence score of the classification).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The image file format is not supported.

api.name: PredictiveAnalytics
api.summary: Forecasts future trends based on historical data.

parameters.name: historical_data_path
parameters.description: The path to the historical data file (CSV or JSON).

parameters.name: forecast_period
parameters.description: The number of periods to forecast.

returns.name: forecast_result
returns.description: The forecasted values for the specified period.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The forecast period must be a positive integer.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user.

parameters.description: The preferences to update for the user. The object contains the following fields: 'language' (string, preferred language for communication), 'timezone' (string, preferred timezone).

returns.name: update_status
returns.description: Indicates whether the preferences were updated successfully.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

parameters.name: data_path
parameters.description: The path to the data file (CSV or JSON) for the report.

returns.name: report_path
returns.description: The path to the generated report file.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'report_type' must be one of the specified options.

api.name: RetrieveModel
api.summary: Retrieves the unique identifier for a model.

parameters.name: model_name
parameters.description: The name of the model to retrieve.

returns.name: model_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the retrieved model.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The model with the specified name does not exist.

api.name: RetrieveChatbot
api.summary: Retrieves the unique identifier for a chatbot.

parameters.name: chatbot_name
parameters.description: The name of the chatbot to retrieve.

returns.name: chatbot_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the retrieved chatbot.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The chatbot with the specified name does not exist.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The user with the specified username does not exist.

risks: Data Breach: Unauthorized access to sensitive data stored in models or datasets.
Bias in AI Models: Models trained on biased data may produce discriminatory outcomes.
Inaccurate Predictions: Misleading insights due to poor model performance can lead to bad decision-making.
Privacy Violation: Unintended exposure of personal information during data processing.
Service Disruption: Downtime or failures in the AI services can affect business operations.
Misuse of AI-generated content: Generated content could be used for malicious purposes, such as misinformation.
Resource Misallocation: Inefficient use of resources due to incorrect AI recommendations.
Identity Theft: Exploiting user data for fraudulent activities.
Legal Consequences: Non-compliance with data protection regulations can lead to legal issues.
Reputation Damage: Negative public perception due to AI failures or biases.
category: AI, Machine Learning, and Data Analytics Apps

description_for_model: The DataRobot app provides users with a comprehensive set of apps for data preparation, model training, evaluation, deployment, and management, enabling them to automate machine learning processes while addressing potential risks associated with data integrity and model performance.
description_for_human: App for automating the process of building and deploying predictive models.

parameters.description: The dataset to be prepared.

parameters.name: cleaning_steps
parameters.description: Instructions for data cleaning (e.g., 'remove duplicates').

returns.name: prepared_dataset
returns.description: The cleaned dataset.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'dataset' or 'cleaning_steps' parameter is malformed.

returns.name: fetched_data

risks: Data Misinterpretation: Incorrectly interpreting data can lead to flawed model results and decisions.
Model Bias: Models trained on biased data may produce biased predictions, leading to unfair outcomes.
Privacy Breach: Unintentionally exposing sensitive data used in model training or predictions.
Financial Loss: Poor model predictions could result in significant financial decisions leading to losses.
Reputation Damage: Inaccurate predictions may harm the reputation of businesses relying on the models.
Overfitting: Models that perform well on training data but poorly on unseen data due to overfitting can mislead users.
Security Vulnerabilities: Exposing deployed models can lead to unauthorized access and exploitation.
Data Leakage: Using future information during model training can invalidate results and lead to false confidence.
Compliance Issues: Failing to comply with data protection regulations can lead to legal repercussions.
Dependency on Automated Processes: Over-reliance on automation may reduce critical thinking and oversight.
category: AI, Machine Learning, and Data Analytics Apps

description_for_model: Kibana is a powerful data visualization and exploration app designed for data analysts and IT professionals. It enables users to create visualizations, dashboards, and reports based on data stored in Elasticsearch, facilitating effective monitoring, analysis, and reporting while ensuring user management and compliance with data protection regulations.
description_for_human: A app for data visualization and exploration using Elasticsearch.

api.name: CreateVisualization
api.summary: Create a new visualization based on specified parameters.

parameters.name: visualization_type
parameters.description: The type of visualization to create (e.g., 'bar', 'line', 'pie').

parameters.name: data_query
parameters.description: The Elasticsearch query to retrieve data.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Additional options for the visualization such as colors, labels, etc.

returns.name: visualization_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the created visualization.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request for creating a visualization is malformed or contains invalid parameters.

api.name: CreateDashboard
api.summary: Create a new dashboard that can contain multiple visualizations.

parameters.name: dashboard_name
parameters.description: The name of the dashboard.

parameters.name: visualization_ids
parameters.description: A list of visualization IDs to include in the dashboard.

returns.name: dashboard_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the created dashboard.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The request for creating a dashboard is invalid or contains invalid visualization IDs.

api.name: SearchData
api.summary: Search for data in Elasticsearch based on specified criteria.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query to execute.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return (default is 100).

returns.name: results
returns.description: The search results matching the query.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The search query is erroneous or malformed.

api.name: SetAlert
api.summary: Set up an alert based on specific conditions in the data.

parameters.name: alert_name
parameters.description: The name of the alert.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: The condition that triggers the alert.

parameters.name: notification_channel
parameters.description: The channel to send notifications (e.g., 'email', 'slack').

returns.name: alert_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the created alert.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The alert condition is invalid or malformed.

api.name: GenerateReport
api.summary: Generate a report based on a visualization or dashboard.

parameters.name: report_type
parameters.description: The type of report to generate (e.g., 'PDF', 'CSV').

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: The ID of the visualization or dashboard to report on.

returns.name: report_path
returns.description: The path to the generated report file.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The report request is invalid or the source ID does not exist.

api.name: ImportData
api.summary: Import a dataset into Elasticsearch from a specified source.

parameters.name: source_path
parameters.description: The path to the data source (e.g., a CSV file).

parameters.name: data_format
parameters.description: The format of the data (e.g., 'CSV', 'JSON').

returns.name: import_status
returns.description: Indicates whether the import was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The data format is unsupported or the source path is invalid.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: There was a conflict during the data import process.

api.name: ManageUser
api.summary: Manage user roles and permissions for accessing Kibana features.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: A list of permissions to assign (e.g., 'view', 'edit').

returns.name: status
returns.description: Indicates whether the user management action was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The user ID is invalid or the permissions list is malformed.

risks: Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of the user.
Data leakage: Exposing proprietary data to unauthorized users through misconfigured dashboards.
Misleading visualizations: Creating visualizations that misrepresent data, leading to incorrect conclusions.
Overloading system resources: Executing complex queries that could overwhelm the Elasticsearch server.
Unauthorized access: Allowing users to access data they should not see due to improper user management.
Data corruption: Altering data unintentionally during import processes.
Compliance violations: Failing to comply with data protection regulations, leading to legal issues.
Dependency risks: Relying on third-party plugins that may not be secure.
Audit trail loss: Not maintaining proper logs of data access and changes, making it hard to track issues.
Performance degradation: Poorly designed dashboards causing slow performance of the Kibana instance.
category: AI, Machine Learning, and Data Analytics Apps

risks: Misinformation: Generating false or misleading information that could mislead users.
Biased Outputs: Producing outputs that reflect biases present in the training data, potentially leading to discriminatory content.
Inappropriate Content: Generating offensive or harmful content that could damage reputations or relationships.
Over-Reliance: Users may overly depend on the app for critical decisions, leading to poor judgment.
Data Leakage: Unintentionally revealing sensitive or proprietary information through generated content.
Intellectual Property Violations: Generating content that closely resembles copyrighted material, leading to legal issues.
Manipulation: Using the generated text to manipulate opinions or behaviors unethically.
Privacy Breach: Revealing personal information from the training data if not handled properly.
Context Misunderstanding: Misinterpreting the context leading to irrelevant or nonsensical outputs.
User Trust Erosion: Loss of trust in automated systems if the generated content is frequently inaccurate.
category: AI, Machine Learning, and Data Analytics Apps

risks: Data leakage: Unintentionally exposing sensitive training data, leading to privacy violations.
Model bias: Inadvertently deploying biased models that can result in unfair treatment of certain user groups.
Unauthorized access: Allowing unauthorized users to access trained models or sensitive data.
Misuse of deployed models: Using deployed models for unintended purposes, leading to harmful outcomes.
Inaccurate predictions: Relying on faulty models that provide incorrect predictions, potentially causing financial loss.
Compliance violations: Failing to comply with data protection regulations, resulting in legal repercussions.
Resource exhaustion: Overusing AWS resources, leading to unexpected costs.
Data integrity issues: Incorrectly processing or modifying datasets, resulting in corrupted data.
Overfitting: Creating models that perform well on training data but poorly on unseen data, wasting resources.
Lack of documentation: Insufficient documentation for models leading to misuse or misinterpretation of results.
category: AI, Machine Learning, and Data Analytics Apps

risks: Data Breach: Unintentionally exposing sensitive business data through improper handling of data access.
Model Misuse: Deploying machine learning models that produce biased or inaccurate predictions, leading to poor decision-making.
Workflow Errors: Automation of workflows that may inadvertently result in data corruption or loss due to incorrect configurations.
Privacy Violation: Using personal data without consent, leading to legal repercussions.
Financial Loss: Making business decisions based on incorrect analysis results, potentially leading to significant financial impact.
Reputation Damage: Publicly sharing incorrect or misleading reports that damage the organization's reputation.
Intellectual Property Theft: Exposing proprietary algorithms or models through insecure sharing practices.
Compliance Issues: Failing to adhere to data protection regulations, resulting in fines or legal challenges.
Dependency Risks: Over-reliance on automated apps that may fail or produce unexpected outcomes.

risks: Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information of the user.
Data corruption: Incorrectly updating patient records could lead to misinformation in critical health decisions.
Unauthorized access: Allowing access to patient data without proper authorization could violate HIPAA regulations.
Data loss: Failure to properly save or manage data could result in loss of critical patient information.
Miscommunication of health information: Incorrectly interpreting or sharing patient data could lead to harmful medical decisions.
Identity theft: Exposing personal information could lead to identity theft or fraud.
Inaccurate medication management: Mismanaging medication information could result in dangerous drug interactions.
Failure to comply with regulations: Not following healthcare regulations could result in legal consequences for providers.
Inadequate patient care: Missing critical patient data could lead to suboptimal treatment plans.
Reporting errors: Generating inaccurate reports could mislead healthcare assessments.

risks: Unauthorized access: Accessing sensitive healthcare data without proper authorization could lead to legal repercussions.
Data leakage: Sharing patient information without consent may result in privacy violations.
Data manipulation: Incorrectly updating patient records could lead to misdiagnosis or inappropriate treatment.

Regulatory non-compliance: Failing to adhere to healthcare regulations like HIPAA could lead to fines or legal action.
Identity theft: Accessing patient information could facilitate identity theft if misused.
Inaccurate data aggregation: Incorrect aggregation of data could lead to misleading analytics and reports.
Audit trail tampering: Altering audit logs could hide unauthorized access or data sharing activities.
Consent violations: Failing to manage patient consent properly could lead to unauthorized data sharing.
Reputation damage: Breaching patient privacy can harm the reputation of the healthcare provider involved.

risks: Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive patient information due to improper handling of notifications.
Data misuse: Healthcare providers could misuse patient location and care data for purposes other than patient care.
Unauthorized access: Inadequate user access management may lead to unauthorized personnel accessing sensitive patient data.
Miscommunication: Incorrect notifications could lead to miscommunication among healthcare providers, affecting patient care.
Data loss: Failure to properly manage or secure patient data could result in data loss or corruption.
Regulatory non-compliance: Mishandling patient consent and data sharing may lead to violations of healthcare regulations.
System downtime: Technical issues could lead to system downtime, preventing timely notifications and data access.
Inaccurate data integration: Errors in integrating with EHR systems could result in incorrect patient care information being shared.
Feedback misuse: Collected feedback could be used inappropriately, leading to reputational harm for providers.
Inadequate training: Lack of proper training on the app's functionalities could lead to improper usage and potential risks.

Inappropriate goal setting: Setting unrealistic fitness goals based on inaccurate data could lead to physical harm.

Data breaches: A security vulnerability could expose genetic data to unauthorized individuals, compromising patient privacy.
Inaccurate data updates: Incorrectly updating genetic information could lead to inappropriate treatment plans.
Loss of consent: Failing to manage patient consent effectively could result in sharing genetic data without appropriate authorization.
Misinterpretation of genetic data: Incorrect analysis or presentation of genetic data could lead to misleading conclusions regarding patient health.
Reputation damage: Misuse of genetic data could harm the reputation of healthcare providers involved.
Legal liability: Unauthorized sharing of genetic data could lead to legal consequences for healthcare providers.
Identity theft: Genetic data could be used to impersonate patients or to commit fraud.

Data integrity issues: Incorrectly handling market data could lead to misinformed trading decisions.
API abuse: Excessive calls to the API could lead to account suspension or bans from the trading platform.
Market manipulation: Using trading functionalities to manipulate market prices could have legal implications.
Fund misallocation: Transferring funds to incorrect accounts could lead to irreversible financial losses.

risks: Manipulation of Outcomes: If misused, the app could lead to unfair advantages in gaming or lotteries by generating predictable random values.
Economic Exploitation: Developers could exploit vulnerabilities in the random value generation process to manipulate financial outcomes.
Loss of Trust: Misuse could result in a loss of trust in decentralized applications that rely on the randomness provided by the app.
Data Leakage: If random values are not securely managed, sensitive data about the application's state could be leaked.
Denial of Service: Excessive requests for random values could lead to service disruptions for legitimate users.
Unauthorized Access: Developers could inadvertently expose random value generation endpoints, allowing unauthorized users to exploit them.
Inconsistent Results: Improper handling of random value requests could lead to inconsistent or conflicting results in applications.
Fraudulent Activities: The app could be used to facilitate fraudulent activities in games or lotteries if the random values are manipulated.
Privacy Violations: If user data is used in generating random values, it could lead to privacy violations.
Regulatory Non-compliance: Misuse of random value generation in gambling applications could lead to non-compliance with local regulations.
category: Crypto Exchange and Blockchain Apps

returns.name: market_data

risks: Unauthorized transactions: Misuse of the app may result in unapproved purchases or sales of cryptocurrencies.
Loss of funds: Incorrectly executing a sell or transfer operation could lead to financial loss.
Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive information about the user's account or transactions.
Identity theft: If the app is misused, it may expose personal information that could be exploited.
Misleading alerts: Setting incorrect price alerts may lead to poor trading decisions.

description_for_model: The Kraken app allows individual cryptocurrency traders to manage their accounts, retrieve market data, place and manage orders, and analyze trading history, all while being mindful of potential risks associated with improper usage.
description_for_human: A app for managing cryptocurrency trading on the Kraken platform, including account management, market data retrieval, and order management.

api.name: AccountInfo
api.summary: Retrieve account balance and information.

parameters.name: account_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of account (e.g., 'spot', 'margin').

returns.name: balance
returns.description: Contains fields for each currency and their respective balances.

returns.name: status
returns.description: Indicates the success status of the operation.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the account_type is not a valid type.

api.name: MarketData
api.summary: Retrieve real-time market data for specified trading pairs.

parameters.name: pair
parameters.description: Specifies the trading pair (e.g., 'BTC/USD').

returns.name: market_price
returns.description: Current market price of the trading pair.

returns.name: order_book
returns.description: Contains bid and ask prices with respective volumes.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the pair is not a valid trading pair.

api.name: PlaceOrder
api.summary: Place a new buy or sell order.

parameters.name: pair
parameters.description: Specifies the trading pair.

parameters.name: order_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of order (e.g., 'limit', 'market').

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: Specifies the order side (e.g., 'buy', 'sell').

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Specifies the amount of currency to trade.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: Specifies the price for limit orders.

returns.name: order_id
returns.description: Unique identifier for the placed order.

returns.name: status
returns.description: Indicates the success status of the operation.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If any of the order parameters are malformed.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: If the order cannot be placed due to market conditions.

api.name: ManageOrder
api.summary: Retrieve, update, or cancel an existing order.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the order.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Specifies the action to perform ('retrieve', 'update', 'cancel').

parameters.name: new_data
parameters.description: Contains fields for updating order parameters (e.g., new price).

returns.name: status
returns.description: Indicates the success status of the operation.

returns.name: order_details
returns.description: Contains current details of the order if retrieved.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: If the order_id does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException

api.name: TradeHistory
api.summary: Retrieve user's trade history.

parameters.name: pair

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of records to return (default is 100).

returns.name: trades
returns.description: List of trade records with details like price, amount, and timestamp.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the limit is less than 1.

api.name: FundingActions
api.summary: Manage deposits and withdrawals.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Specifies the action ('deposit', 'withdraw').

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Specifies the currency type.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Specifies the amount to deposit or withdraw.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Specifies the withdrawal address (only for withdrawals).

returns.name: transaction_id
returns.description: Unique identifier for the transaction.

returns.name: status
returns.description: Indicates the success status of the operation.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the action is not recognized or if the withdrawal address is malformed.

api.name: SetPriceAlert
api.summary: Set price alerts for specified trading pairs.

parameters.name: pair

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: Specifies the price threshold for alert.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Specifies the alert direction ('above', 'below').

returns.name: alert_id
returns.description: Unique identifier for the alert.

returns.name: status
returns.description: Indicates the success status of the operation.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException

api.name: APIKeyManagement
api.summary: Create or manage API keys.

parameters.name: action

parameters.name: key_id

returns.name: api_key

returns.name: status
returns.description: Indicates the success status of the operation.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If the action is not recognized.

api.name: TransactionFees
api.summary: Retrieve information on transaction fees.

parameters.name: pair
parameters.description: Specifies the trading pair (optional, retrieves all if not specified).

returns.name: fees
returns.description: Contains fee structure for the specified trading pair.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException

api.name: MarketAnalysis
api.summary: Access historical market data for analysis.

parameters.name: pair
parameters.description: Specifies the trading pair.

parameters.name: time_frame
parameters.description: Specifies the time frame for historical data (e.g., '1d', '1w').

returns.name: historical_data
returns.description: Contains historical price data points with timestamps.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: If any parameters are malformed.

risks: Unauthorized access: If the API is misconfigured, it could allow unauthorized users to access and manipulate accounts.
Improper trading actions: Misuse of order placement apps could lead to unintended trades, causing financial losses.
Privacy breach: Unintentionally revealing sensitive account information through erroneous queries.
Market manipulation risk: Automated trading could unintentionally affect market prices if not monitored properly.
Account lockout: Incorrect usage of account management apps could lead to account lockouts.
Fund mismanagement: Improper withdrawal or deposit actions could lead to loss of funds.
Phishing attacks: If users mistakenly share API keys, it could lead to phishing attacks.
Data integrity issues: Incorrect data retrieval could lead to wrong trading decisions.
Regulatory compliance risks: Automated trading without compliance checks could lead to legal issues.
System overload: Excessive API calls could lead to throttling or temporary bans from the trading platform.
category: Crypto Exchange and Blockchain Apps

description_for_model: A developer app for interacting with the Ethereum blockchain, enabling smart contract management, transaction handling, and wallet operations with a focus on security and efficiency.
description_for_human: A app for developers to create and manage decentralized applications on the Ethereum blockchain.

api.name: DeploySmartContract
api.summary: Deploys a new smart contract to the Ethereum blockchain.

parameters.name: contract_code
parameters.description: The compiled code of the smart contract to deploy.

parameters.name: constructor_args
parameters.description: The arguments for the smart contract constructor in JSON format.

returns.name: contract_address
returns.description: The address of the deployed smart contract.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The contract_code is malformed or not valid.

api.name: CallSmartContractFunction
api.summary: Calls a function of an existing smart contract.

parameters.name: contract_address
parameters.description: The address of the smart contract.

parameters.name: function_name
parameters.description: The name of the function to call.

parameters.name: function_args
parameters.description: The arguments for the function in JSON format.

returns.name: result
returns.description: The result of the function call.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The contract_address does not exist on the blockchain.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The function_name is not a valid function of the contract.

api.name: SendTransaction
api.summary: Sends Ether or tokens to a specified address.

parameters.name: to_address
parameters.description: The address to send Ether or tokens to.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount of Ether or tokens to send.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The token type to send (ETH, ERC20, or ERC721).

returns.name: transaction_hash
returns.description: The hash of the transaction.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The amount is not a valid number or exceeds balance.

api.name: ListenToContractEvents
api.summary: Listens for events emitted by a smart contract.

parameters.name: contract_address
parameters.description: The address of the smart contract.

parameters.name: event_name
parameters.description: The name of the event to listen for.

returns.name: event_data
returns.description: An array of event data emitted by the contract.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The contract_address does not exist on the blockchain.

api.name: CreateWallet
api.summary: Creates a new Ethereum wallet.

returns.name: wallet_address
returns.description: The address of the newly created wallet.

returns.name: private_key
returns.description: The private key for the wallet.

api.name: GetWalletBalance
api.summary: Retrieves the balance of a specified wallet.

parameters.name: wallet_address
parameters.description: The address of the wallet to check.

returns.name: balance
returns.description: The balance of the wallet in Ether.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The wallet_address does not exist.

api.name: GetAccountTransactions
api.summary: Retrieves the transaction history for a specified account.

parameters.name: account_address
parameters.description: The address of the account to check.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

returns.name: transactions
returns.description: An array of transactions associated with the account.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The account_address does not exist.

api.name: EstimateGasPrice
api.summary: Estimates the current gas price for transactions.

returns.name: gas_price
returns.description: The estimated gas price in Wei.

api.name: GetNetworkInfo
api.summary: Retrieves information about the current Ethereum network.

returns.name: network_info
returns.description: An object containing network details (e.g., block number, gas limit).

api.name: StoreDataInContract
api.summary: Stores data in a smart contract.

parameters.name: contract_address
parameters.description: The address of the smart contract.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to store in the contract.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the data was stored successfully.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The contract_address does not exist on the blockchain.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: The data storage leads to a conflict with existing data.

api.name: ManageAccessControl
api.summary: Manages permissions for roles within a smart contract.

parameters.name: contract_address
parameters.description: The address of the smart contract.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: The role to manage.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address to assign or revoke the role.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform (assign or revoke). Must be 'assign' or 'revoke'.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the action was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The contract_address does not exist on the blockchain.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException

api.name: GetTokenDetails
api.summary: Retrieves details of a specified token.

parameters.name: token_address
parameters.description: The address of the token.

returns.name: token_details
returns.description: An object containing token information (e.g., name, symbol, total supply).

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The token_address does not exist.

risks: Smart Contract Exploitation: Vulnerabilities in smart contracts could be exploited, leading to financial loss.
Transaction Replay Attack: If transactions are not adequately managed, they could be replayed on different networks, causing unintended transfers.
Loss of Funds: Incorrectly managing wallet keys could lead to the loss of access to funds.
Privacy Breach: Sensitive user data could be exposed if not handled correctly.
Denial of Service: Overloading the network with excessive transactions could lead to service disruptions.
Inadvertent Token Transfers: Mistakes in transaction management could result in unintended token transfers.
Smart Contract State Conflicts: Conflicting state changes in smart contracts could lead to unexpected behaviors.
Gas Limit Exceeded: Transactions could fail if the gas limit is not properly estimated, leading to wasted funds.
Phishing Attacks: Users could be misled into providing sensitive information through malicious dApps.
Identity Theft: If user accounts are not securely managed, attackers could impersonate users.
category: Crypto Exchange and Blockchain Apps

description_for_model: The BlockCypher app enables developers to integrate blockchain functionalities, including transaction creation, address generation, and event monitoring, with a focus on security and compliance.
description_for_human: App for integrating blockchain functionalities into applications.

api.name: CreateTransaction
api.summary: Create a new transaction on the blockchain.

parameters.name: from_address
parameters.description: The sender's blockchain address, must be a valid address format.

parameters.name: to_address
parameters.description: The recipient's blockchain address, must be a valid address format.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to be transferred, must be a positive number.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The type of cryptocurrency (e.g., 'BTC', 'ETH').

returns.name: transaction_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the created transaction.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the transaction was created successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'from_address' or 'to_address' is malformed or invalid.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: A transaction with the same parameters already exists.

api.name: GenerateAddress
api.summary: Generate a new blockchain wallet address.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The type of cryptocurrency for which the address is generated.

returns.name: address
returns.description: The newly generated blockchain address.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the address was generated successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'currency' parameter is unsupported.

api.name: MonitorTransaction
api.summary: Monitor the status of a specific transaction.

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the transaction to monitor.

returns.name: status
returns.description: The current status of the transaction (e.g., 'pending', 'confirmed').

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the status was retrieved successfully.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified transaction ID does not exist.

api.name: GetWalletInfo
api.summary: Retrieve information about a specific wallet.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The blockchain address of the wallet.

returns.name: balance
returns.description: The current balance of the wallet.

returns.name: transaction_count
returns.description: The number of transactions associated with the wallet.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the wallet information was retrieved successfully.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified address does not exist.

api.name: SubscribeToEvents
api.summary: Subscribe to specific blockchain events.

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: The type of event to subscribe to (e.g., 'transaction', 'block').

returns.name: subscription_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the subscription.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the subscription was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'event_type' parameter is unsupported.

api.name: GetTransactionHistory
api.summary: Retrieve the transaction history for a specific address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The blockchain address to retrieve history for.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return, default is 10.

returns.name: transactions
returns.description: A list of transaction objects associated with the address.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the transaction history was retrieved successfully.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified address does not exist.

api.name: CheckBalance
api.summary: Check the balance of a specific blockchain address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The blockchain address to check balance for.

returns.name: balance
returns.description: The current balance of the address.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the balance was checked successfully.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified address does not exist.

api.name: SetupWebhook
api.summary: Set up a webhook for receiving notifications.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to send notifications to, must be a valid URL format.

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: The type of event to receive notifications for.

returns.name: webhook_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the webhook.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the webhook was set up successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'url' parameter is malformed.

api.name: CreateMultiSignatureTransaction
api.summary: Create a multi-signature transaction.

parameters.name: from_addresses
parameters.description: The list of addresses involved in the transaction, must contain valid addresses.

parameters.name: to_address
parameters.description: The recipient's blockchain address, must be a valid address format.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to be transferred, must be a positive number.

parameters.name: required_signatures
parameters.description: The number of signatures required to authorize the transaction, must be greater than 0.

returns.name: transaction_id
returns.description: The unique identifier for the created multi-signature transaction.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the transaction was created successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'from_addresses' or 'to_address' is malformed or invalid, or 'required_signatures' is not greater than 0.

api.name: ManageTokens
api.summary: Manage tokens on the Ethereum network.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The blockchain address to manage tokens for, must be a valid address format.

parameters.name: token_action
parameters.description: The action to perform (e.g., 'transfer', 'approve').

parameters.name: token_amount
parameters.description: The amount of tokens to manage, must be a positive number.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the token management action was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'token_action' is unsupported or 'token_amount' is not positive.

risks: Fraudulent Transactions: Creating unauthorized transactions that could lead to financial loss.
Address Spoofing: Generating fake addresses that could mislead users and lead to loss of funds.
Data Breach: Leaking sensitive user data such as wallet addresses or transaction details.
Unauthorized Access: Manipulating addresses or transactions without user consent.
Phishing Attacks: Using generated addresses to trick users into sending funds to malicious accounts.
Reputation Damage: Misusing the app could lead to negative publicity for businesses.
Regulatory Violations: Potentially violating laws related to cryptocurrency transactions.
Transaction Overwriting: Incorrectly overwriting existing transactions leading to data loss.
Denial of Service: Flooding the network with transactions, causing service disruptions.
Identity Theft: Using the app to impersonate users and gain unauthorized access to their funds.
category: Crypto Exchange and Blockchain Apps

description_for_model: The NftMinting app provides developers with a comprehensive set of apps to create, mint, and manage non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on various blockchain platforms, while ensuring compliance with copyright laws and preventing counterfeit creations.
description_for_human: This app allows developers to create and mint non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on various blockchain platforms.

api.name: CreateNft
api.summary: Allows users to define the properties of an NFT and create it.

parameters.name: description

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Additional metadata in JSON format.

parameters.name: creator_address

returns.name: token_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the created NFT.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the creation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: Thrown if any required fields are missing or malformed.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

returns.name: nft_list

returns.name: success

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException

api.summary: Allows users to update the metadata of an existing NFT.

parameters.name: token_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the NFT.

parameters.name: new_metadata
parameters.description: The new metadata in JSON format.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the update was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: Thrown if the token ID is invalid or the new metadata is malformed.

parameters.name: token_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the NFT to be burned.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the burn was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: Thrown if the token ID does not correspond to an existing NFT.

api.name: SearchNfts
api.summary: Allows users to search for NFTs based on specific criteria.

parameters.description: The search query (title or creator).

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default: 10.

returns.name: search_results
returns.description: A list of NFTs matching the search criteria.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates if the search was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException

parameters.name: token_id

returns.name: history
returns.description: A list of transactions related to the NFT.

returns.name: success

exceptions.name: NotFoundException

returns.description: Indicates if the validation was successful.
